results.title: Yes, You Can Do Better Than the Great American Lawn
results.abstract: There are any number of ecologically friendly alternatives to that lawn you’re so proud of — and they look nice, too. Here’s how to start slowly.

media.caption: Low-growing wild strawberry (Fragaria virginiana) is one of the ecological horticulturist Daniel Jaffe Wilder’s favorite native lawn alternatives. It can withstand foot traffic, and the plants produce small, edible fruit.
